page.title: 02Topography of Stockton
page.content: Norton occupies a low spur of land (83m.O.D.) extending N.E.from Winscote Hill & Knolls Coppice (part of Apley Terrace & the Severn Valley). North & East of the village the land maintains a plateau level of 79m.O.D. before descending steeply to the incision of the River Worfe at Higford. To the south & west of the village rhe land falls away to the valley of the River Severn. Geologically the area is floored by Triassic Bunter Pebble Beds(red sandstone) & the Upper & Lower Mottled Sandstones. In certain localities glacial gravels occur, otherwise there is no superficial glacial drift present.
